items.title: Chief Technology Officer (AI & Data)
bullets: After validating the core technology, I stepped up to lead the engineering team as CTO. My focus shifted from "Does it work?" to "Does it scale?".

I architected the production system, deploying PyTorch models onto constrained edge devices using Docker and ONNX, and led the team to build a Django service layer with real-time WebSocket delivery for operators.
Optimizing UX and inference speed cut inspection setup from 30 minutes to under 60 seconds, turning a complex R&D prototype into a usable industrial product.

items.title: R&D Scientist (Computer Vision)
bullets: At Therness R&D, data scarcity was the core challenge: standard CV models failed on thermal datasets. I focused on one-shot and low-data learning.
I built foundational algorithms that could detect defects with minimal examples and established a rigorous error-analysis workflow to harden models for field use.
This phase was about deep problem-solving and validating that the technology was viable before scaling to production.

items.title: Algorithm Development for Weld Path Optimization | Data Scientist Intern
bullets: At Ades Consulting, I tackled the geometric challenge of automating weld paths by processing raw STL meshes to generate optimal robotic trajectories.
I developed a custom pipeline that analyzed mesh topology to predict the most efficient weld path, achieving an 86% match rate with expert human trajectories.
The project sharpened my computational geometry and algorithm design skills, moving beyond pixel-based CV to vector-based spatial reasoning.

items.title: Statistical Analyst (Market Research)
bullets: At Shomal Market Insights, I learned the importance of data integrity while analyzing large survey datasets at scale.
Standard tools were too slow, so I optimized critical data-processing steps in C++ to improve runtime and reliability.
This experience marked my shift from a statistician analyzing the past to an engineer building tools for the future.

items.title: Data Analyst Intern
bullets: At the University of Hormozgan, I analyzed 10 years of data from 5,000+ students to uncover employment drivers.
Using statistical modeling, I proposed curriculum interventions; employment rates improved by 8.4% after implementation.
It cemented my belief that rigorous data analysis translates directly into real-world impact.

Added a lightweight QA checklist for thermal data drift before each model run.

Prototyped efficiency tactics like layer freezing and adaptive local steps for heterogeneous clients.
Documented a simple reproducibility recipe to compare runs across machines.

about.title: About
intro: My journey started in Applied Statistics, where I learned that data creates the map. Today, as an AI & Computer Vision Engineer, I build the engines that navigate it.

sections.heading: Production-Grade AI
body: Having served as a CTO in the industrial AI sector, I realized that a model's accuracy in a Jupyter Notebook means nothing if it fails on the factory floor.

That's why my focus is strictly on production-grade AI: building real-time, edge-optimized thermography systems that withstand the chaos of the real world. I don't just train models; I design full-stack inference architectures that deliver actionable insights in milliseconds.
